p:
The α-glucosidase activity and inhibition were calculated from the blank-corrected absorbance data as a percentage of the negative (uninhibited) control using the following formula:
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$${\text{Percentage enzyme activity = }}\frac{\text{Blank-corrected Absorbance of test well}}{\text{Blank-corrected Absorbance of negative control}} \times 1 0 0$$\end{document}
Percentage enzyme activity =
Blank-corrected Absorbance of test well
Blank-corrected Absorbance of negative control
× 100
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$${\text{Percentage enzyme inhibition = 1}} - \left( {\frac{\text{Blank-corrected Absorbance of test well}}{\text{Blank-corrected Absorbance of negative control}}} \right) \times 1 0 0$$\end{document}
Percentage enzyme inhibition = 1
-
Blank-corrected Absorbance of test well
Blank-corrected Absorbance of negative control
× 100
